related_questions.question: Bandingkan gambar diatas menggunakan teks bahasa Inggris koperatif dan superlatif!​

answers.answer:
Jawaban:

Degrees of Comparison:

1. A donkey is bigger than a turtle and a snail. (Comparative Degree)

2. A snail is smaller than a turtle and a donkey. (Comparative Degree)

3. The donkey has the biggest body in the picture. (Superlative Degree)

4. The snail is the smallest animal in the picture. (Superlative degree)

Penjelasan:

Comparative degree dibentuk dengan menambahkan akhiran "-er" dan menambahkan more ... than jika kata sifatnya terdiri lebih dari satu suku kata.

Contoh : Tony is younger than i am. (Tony lebih muda dariku)

I think Book A is more interesting than Book B.

Superlative degree dengan menambahkan akhiran "-est" the most jika kata sifat terdiri lebih dari 2 suku kata dan memiliki arti sebagai yang paling sehingga tidak bisa dibandingkan lagi.

Contoh : I am the youngest person in my family. (Aku adalah orang termuda / yang paling muda di dalam keluargaku)

Last night my brother told me the most interesting story that i have ever heard

Semoga membantu ya.

1. The recount text is a text that....
A. Telling some funnies story.
B. Telling a story to entertain the readers.
C. Retells past events in the order the happened.
D. Tells many events that will be happen in the future.​

answers.answer:
Jawaban:

C. Retells past events in the order the happened.

Penjelasan:

Jawaban:

curlier

Penjelasan:

Comparative (Perbandingan)

Kata kunci perbandingan itu ada di kata "than",yang artinya daripada. Bentuk comparative dari curly adalah curlier (kalau diakhiri dengan y, ganti y dengan i lalu tambah er). Semoga membantu!

V = 144 x 12

V = 1.728

related_questions.question:
Buatlah kalimat berikut present perfect tensse 2. He (study) English for 3 years.    3.1 (live) in Kebumen for 15 years.

4.1 (smoke) since I was a child. 5. They (eat) it all.

6. We (work) for 5 hours.

8. We (submit) the assignment on time 9. He (do) it perfectly​

answers.answer:
Jawaban:

2. He has studied English for 3 years.

3. I have lived in Kebumen for 15 years.

4. I have smoked since I was a child.

5. They have eaten it all.

6. We have worked for 5 hours.

8. We have submitted the assignment on time.

9. He has done it perfectly.

Formula:

S + have or has + past participle.

S + have not (haven't) or has not (hasn't) + past participle
